Description: Fragment of a seal-impression, the fine brown Nile clay has some mica inclusions and was hardened after excavation. The rear shows two flat areas joined by a convex rounded area like from a bag or suchlike (similar to EA86732, EA86742, EA86756, and EA86759). Several impressions of a turned string in the break with a width of 0.2 and 0.3 cm. The top shows finger impressions and a part of an oval scarab-like seal-impression. Visible is a horizontal sign that might be a plant or curled line, underneath a sign that could be either a standing lion or a dog with an inwards curled tail. The rest is broken off.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.7 temple magazine
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
